<img style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 450px; margin: 0 auto;" width="450" alt="Daily Brew" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86546217fa0.jpg">

<tr>
<th align="right" class="clear sponsor" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:13px;color:#252525;padding-right:8px;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:13px;color:#494949;padding-right:8px;" valign="middle">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;margin-top:15px;margin-bottom:15px;line-height:22px;">
TOGETHER WITH
</p>
</th>
<th class="clear" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400">
<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N9515.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23898138.269941425;dc_trk_aid=464506123;dc_trk_cid=130161754;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="WHOOP" style="width:100%;max-width: 132px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="132" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8xNDIvMTU4MjU4Mzc5Ny1XSE9PUF9Mb2dvX1JfQmxhY2sucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning.</strong> When you’re holed up in your apartment with no end in sight,<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>you start to count your blessings. One of those is the internet. It’s allowed us to stay connected to families, friends, colleagues, yoga instructors, religious leaders, and musical artists even while we’re physically apart. Maybe it's not so socially isolating after all? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NYT’s Kevin Roose <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/17/technology/coronavirus-how-to-live-online.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said it best</a>: “I<span>f there is a silver lining in this crisis, it may be that the virus is forcing us to use the internet as it was always meant to be used—to connect with one another, share information and resources, and come up with collective solutions to urgent problems."</span></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/17/potential-addition-stimulus-bill-1000-cash-payments?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Add @Steve-Mnuchin-7 on Venmo Now
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Steve Mnuchin handing you money " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDYvbW51Y2hpbl9oYW5kb3V0cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Trump administration might send <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/salvadorhernandez/coronavirus-trump-mnuchin-1000-check-economy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1,000 or more</a> your way. Checks for a thousand smackeroos to some Americans could sneak into a $1.2 trillion stimulus package the president and his team are trying to push through Congress. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What they’re up against (deep breath):</strong> Service and travel sectors are collapsing, a recession may already be underway, and we’re in the middle of a historic stock market sell-off.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The stimulus bill reportedly includes ~$50 billion for the airline industry plus assistance for small businesses, among other measures. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The embrace of direct payments is a 180 for the administration</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Director of the National Economic Council Larry Kudlow scoffed at cash rebates as “helicopter money from the sky” earlier this month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But we weren’t writing this newsletter from our friend’s cousin’s La-Z-Boy earlier this month. As more and more workers get laid off (or furloughed or temporarily laid off), they need a lifeline. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Republican Sen. Mitt Romney said in a press release the payout would “help fill the gaps” between cushions like paid leave and unemployment insurance. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The idea has a supporter in Palo Alto.</strong> Mark Zuckerberg <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/facebook-give-1-000-bonuses-employees-coronavirus-assistance-n1161871?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said yesterday</a> that all 45,000 Facebook employees will get a onetime $1,000 bonus. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">One notorious gang leader is feeling pretty smug </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Businessman and former presidential candidate Andrew Yang. The chief policy proposal of his campaign was the “Freedom Dividend,” a $1,000 monthly payment to every American. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin’s rebate would be a one-time thing, and it wouldn’t go to every American. “We don't need to send people who make $1 million a year checks,” he said. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, Yang’s Freedom Dividend was about mitigating inequality, not a global health crisis. “I should have been talking about a pandemic,” Yang <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/03/coronavirus-romney-yang-money/608134/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quipped</a> to The Atlantic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the administration hopes to have checks in the mail in the next two weeks.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/17/restaurant-industry-set-collapse-without-government-help?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Restaurants: Too Small to Fail
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="restaurant industry " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDUvcmVzdGF1cmFudF9wYXRpby5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.needpix.com/photo/download/1709388/restaurant-outside-seat-cozy-gastronomy-drink-out-beer-sit" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Needpix</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“I always knew that when the end came,” NYT restaurant critic Pete Wells <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/16/dining/restaurants-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a>, “New Yorkers would watch it from a bar.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, if the end <em>is</em> near, we can confirm we’re nowhere near a bar. Of all the industries suckerpunched by coronavirus, restaurants might be in the worst shape. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some of the largest U.S. states and cities have told restaurants to close or offer takeout/delivery only. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On Sunday, year-over-year </span><span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRbPuAyJy74UmbF6kLXFGXDk2eX3N6zvRLzxPamG8FAA3E-SVqMOMSIht-eYEF_4qrNGOJuPbDjTsPD/pubhtml?urp=gmail_link&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">OpenTable bookings</a></span><span> were down 70% in Boston, 62% in Seattle, and 69% in New York City.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Americans now <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2020/03/americas-restaurants-will-need-a-miracle/608119/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spend more</a> at restaurants than they do at grocery stores. And there are roughly as many jobs in food service as in manufacturing, writes The Atlantic.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But all that's threatened when people can’t go out to eat. Without a government bailout, the industry could collapse. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Momofuku’s Dave Chang with the bottom line:</strong> “Remember in Avengers Infinity War when Thanos snapped his fingers and half of all life instantly disintegrated? That’s what is gonna happen to the restaurant industry <a href="https://twitter.com/davidchang/status/1239342421563117569?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unless we get some help</a>.”</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/17/coronavirus-drives-surge-traffic-online-publishers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Eyes Up Here Please
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Ron Burgundy " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=359 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/250/ron_burgundy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Ron Burgundy " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/250/ron_burgundy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve got lots of new faces reading this, so first we want to say hi. Hi! </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We’re not alone: </strong>Media companies are experiencing big traffic bumps as people flock to coronavirus coverage. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Up to 15% of daily web traffic is going to content about coronavirus, per traffic analytics firm Parse.ly. That increase is <a href="https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-content-web-traffic-fb030a18-e1b5-4d4a-b062-1b2499f221ba.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">led by stories</a> about travel restrictions, social distancing, and #FlattenTheCurve, writes Axios. And last week, coronavirus coverage beat election coverage by 15x. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Consumers are also spending ~30% more time with that content over last year, per Chartbeat. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Media companies</strong> <strong style="color:#000">want to meet that demand</strong>, so they’re <a href="https://medium.com/the-idea/the-latest-publishers-adapt-news-products-and-paywall-strategies-in-response-to-covid-19-mar-321c8c01fb95?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launching new products</a>, from coronavirus blogs to coronavirus podcasts (CNN’s hit 1 million downloads a week after launch). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Outlets including Bloomberg, NYT, and Wired made coronavirus coverage free to access while others are un-paywalling “essential” content. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every country, state, and city is facing unique outbreak conditions, which has reinforced the importance of local journalism following years of budget cuts, layoffs, and closures. Local papers on the front lines, like the Seattle Times, have also seen readership and subscriptions jump.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>It’s no surprise that Alex (our CEO and Navy SEAL in disguise) has stayed healthy this season and surpassed all of his goals for sleep and recovery with <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N9515.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23898138.269941425;dc_trk_aid=464506123;dc_trk_cid=130117853;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP</a>. And that’s especially important now as people hunker down and do everything possible to stay healthy.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>The science says it all. <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N9515.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23898138.269941425;dc_trk_aid=464506123;dc_trk_cid=130117853;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP</a> sleep insights improve sleep quality and are incredibly accurate (we’re not just saying that, it’s been proven by 3rd party validation). And just in case you needed one more reason to get WHOOP, sleep is the #1 natural way to boost immunity. So uhh yeah, you should get more of that. </span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>Even as creative writers, we are geeking out on the data and analytics we get from <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N9515.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23898138.269941425;dc_trk_aid=464506123;dc_trk_cid=130117853;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP</a>. It gives us a <strong style="color:#000">deep dive into our REM, heart rate variability, circadian rhythms, and much more</strong>.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>Join the ranks of fitness gurus, professional athletes, and Brew CEO Alex Lieberman. </span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N9515.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23898138.269941425;dc_trk_aid=464506123;dc_trk_cid=130161892;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Stay on top of your health and become a WHOOP member today</a><span>.</span></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COMMUNICATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/17/call-zoomers-gen-z-flocks-zoom-quarantine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Zoom U
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Animals graduating on Zoom videoconferencing " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDQvem9vbV9ncmFkdWF0aW9uLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><div class="css-901oao css-bfa6kz r-1re7ezh r-18u37iz r-1qd0xha r-a023e6 r-16dba41 r-ad9z0x r-bcqeeo r-qvutc0"><span class="css-901oao css-16my406 r-1qd0xha r-ad9z0x r-bcqeeo r-qvutc0">@leoehlers1</span></div></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From handshakes to two-ply, we’re all craving some normalcy. For the homebound and quarantined, Zoom is offering an unconventional return to socialization. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Sunday, <span>almost 600,000 people downloaded the video conferencing app, a record number.</span> What began as an enterprise platform now houses concerts, church services, and even art exhibits.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Other apps like FaceTime, Skype, and Marco Polo are also doing double-time. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Cisco’s Webex </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/17/cisco-ceo-says-5point5-billion-minutes-of-webex-meetings-due-to-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">logged</a></span><span> 5.5 billion meeting minutes the first 11 business days of March.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Zoom’s newfound popularity (and $30+ billion valuation) comes with special cultural cachet. Gen Zers have jokingly called themselves “Zoomers” for years, but in these socially distant times Zoom <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/17/style/zoom-parties-coronavirus-memes.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hosts</a> their blind dates and birthday parties, the NYT reports. Zoom now has “hotter” brand association than incumbents like Hangouts, says D.A. Davidson analyst Rishi Jaluria. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>many universities have moved all instruction to Zoom, so in a few years when those students start working, the company should get another boost, Jaluria notes. But it’ll still need to innovate to remain a mainstay of online life after the coronavirus crisis calms.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/17/espn-shares-details-coronavirus-programming?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When the Going Gets Tough, ESPN Airs Chess Boxing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Boxer sitting down, taking deep breath " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/248/boxer.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Boxer sitting down, taking deep breath " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/248/boxer.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>CBS on Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Tom Brady said he was leaving the New England Patriots yesterday morning, we all let out a sigh of relief—not only because it’s the end of a era, but also because it gives ESPN something to talk about.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus pandemic has wiped out virtually all live sports around the world besides the Turkish Süper Lig, which we are currently watching out of desperation. Yesterday, ESPN’s programming chief <a href="https://www.espnfrontrow.com/2020/03/the-challenge-is-that-now-we-need-to-replicate-that-dynamic-24-hours-a-day-seven-days-a-week-across-multiple-networks/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shared his vision</a> for the next few months as the network confronts a gaping hole in its schedule.</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Continue reporting on coronavirus’s impacts on the sports world.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dip into the archives to air classic games (but this isn’t as easy as it sounds because of complicated rights agreements). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Showcase “stunt events” and niche sports like it’s done with its “ESPN8: The Ocho” project.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Potentially move up the release date of original programming. Unfortunately, the Michael Jordan doc </span><span><em>The Last Dance </em></span><span>isn’t ready yet.</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>while this spring has basically been canceled, once we beat this thing the fall sports slate could be epic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/249/sports_coronavirus_tweet.png" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Tweet about 2020 sports tournaments being pushed to the fall "></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>@RiggsBarstool</em> </small></p>

Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Trump administration might send \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/salvadorhernandez/coronavirus-trump-mnuchin-1000-check-economy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1,000 or more\u003c/a\u003e your way. Checks for a thousand smackeroos to some Americans could sneak into a $1.2 trillion stimulus package the president and his team are trying to push through Congress. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat they’re up against (deep breath):\u003c/strong\u003e Service and travel sectors are collapsing, a recession may already be underway, and we’re in the middle of a historic stock market sell-off.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe stimulus bill reportedly includes ~$50 billion for the airline industry plus assistance for small businesses, among other measures. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe embrace of direct payments is a 180 for the administration\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDirector of the National Economic Council Larry Kudlow scoffed at cash rebates as “helicopter money from the sky” earlier this month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut we weren’t writing this newsletter from our friend’s cousin’s La-Z-Boy earlier this month. As more and more workers get laid off (or furloughed or temporarily laid off), they need a lifeline. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRepublican Sen. Mitt Romney said in a press release the payout would “help fill the gaps” between cushions like paid leave and unemployment insurance. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe idea has a supporter in Palo Alto.\u003c/strong\u003e Mark Zuckerberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/facebook-give-1-000-bonuses-employees-coronavirus-assistance-n1161871?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid yesterday\u003c/a\u003e that all 45,000 Facebook employees will get a onetime $1,000 bonus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOne notorious gang leader is feeling pretty smug \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBusinessman and former presidential candidate Andrew Yang. The chief policy proposal of his campaign was the “Freedom Dividend,” a $1,000 monthly payment to every American. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTreasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin’s rebate would be a one-time thing, and it wouldn’t go to every American. “We don't need to send people who make $1 million a year checks,” he said. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, Yang’s Freedom Dividend was about mitigating inequality, not a global health crisis. “I should have been talking about a pandemic,” Yang \u003ca href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/03/coronavirus-romney-yang-money/608134/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equipped\u003c/a\u003e to The Atlantic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe administration hopes to have checks in the mail in the next two weeks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e, “New Yorkers would watch it from a bar.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, if the end \u003cem\u003eis\u003c/em\u003e near, we can confirm we’re nowhere near a bar. Of all the industries suckerpunched by coronavirus, restaurants might be in the worst shape. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome of the largest U.S. states and cities have told restaurants to close or offer takeout/delivery only. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOn Sunday, year-over-year \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRbPuAyJy74UmbF6kLXFGXDk2eX3N6zvRLzxPamG8FAA3E-SVqMOMSIht-eYEF_4qrNGOJuPbDjTsPD/pubhtml?urp=gmail_link\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOpenTable bookings\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e were down 70% in Boston, 62% in Seattle, and 69% in New York City.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAmericans now \u003ca href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2020/03/americas-restaurants-will-need-a-miracle/608119/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espend more\u003c/a\u003e at restaurants than they do at grocery stores. And there are roughly as many jobs in food service as in manufacturing, writes The Atlantic.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut all that's threatened when people can’t go out to eat. Without a government bailout, the industry could collapse. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMomofuku’s Dave Chang with the bottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e “Remember in Avengers Infinity War when Thanos snapped his fingers and half of all life instantly disintegrated? That’s what is gonna happen to the restaurant industry \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/davidchang/status/1239342421563117569?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunless we get some help\u003c/a\u003e.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’ve got lots of new faces reading this, so first we want to say hi. Hi! \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe’re not alone: \u003c/strong\u003eMedia companies are experiencing big traffic bumps as people flock to coronavirus coverage. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUp to 15% of daily web traffic is going to content about coronavirus, per traffic analytics firm Parse.ly. That increase is \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-content-web-traffic-fb030a18-e1b5-4d4a-b062-1b2499f221ba.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eled by stories\u003c/a\u003e about travel restrictions, social distancing, and #FlattenTheCurve, writes Axios. And last week, coronavirus coverage beat election coverage by 15x. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eConsumers are also spending ~30% more time with that content over last year, per Chartbeat. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMedia companies\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ewant to meet that demand\u003c/strong\u003e, so they’re \u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/the-idea/the-latest-publishers-adapt-news-products-and-paywall-strategies-in-response-to-covid-19-mar-321c8c01fb95?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunching new products\u003c/a\u003e, from coronavirus blogs to coronavirus podcasts (CNN’s hit 1 million downloads a week after launch). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOutlets including Bloomberg, NYT, and Wired made coronavirus coverage free to access while others are un-paywalling “essential” content. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEvery country, state, and city is facing unique outbreak conditions, which has reinforced the importance of local journalism following years of budget cuts, layoffs, and closures. Local papers on the front lines, like the Seattle Times, have also seen readership and subscriptions jump.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrom handshakes to two-ply, we’re all craving some normalcy. For the homebound and quarantined, Zoom is offering an unconventional return to socialization. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Sunday, \u003cspan\u003ealmost 600,000 people downloaded the video conferencing app, a record number.\u003c/span\u003e What began as an enterprise platform now houses concerts, church services, and even art exhibits.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOther apps like FaceTime, Skype, and Marco Polo are also doing double-time. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCisco’s Webex \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/17/cisco-ceo-says-5point5-billion-minutes-of-webex-meetings-due-to-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elogged\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 5.5 billion meeting minutes the first 11 business days of March.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Zoom’s newfound popularity (and $30+ billion valuation) comes with special cultural cachet. Gen Zers have jokingly called themselves “Zoomers” for years, but in these socially distant times Zoom \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/17/style/zoom-parties-coronavirus-memes.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehosts\u003c/a\u003e their blind dates and birthday parties, the NYT reports. Zoom now has “hotter” brand association than incumbents like Hangouts, says D.A. Davidson analyst Rishi Jaluria. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003emany universities have moved all instruction to Zoom, so in a few years when those students start working, the company should get another boost, Jaluria notes.
